name: Italian Torta with Mascarpone, Gorgonzola, and Walnuts
author: Buckwheat Queen
summary: This savory spread is served in the form of a cake and served at Christmas and New Year's parties in Italy. It's decadent spread on bread or crackers. It is usually served with mostarda di frutta (candied fruit in a spicy, sweet syrup). If you can't find that, serve with crisp pears and honey. If you like, you can use sprigs of rosemary, some cinnamon bark, or sticks to decorate a forest scene on the top.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups creamy Gorgonzola cheese, diced into small cubes
directions: Line a loaf pan with plastic wrap
Put Gorgonzola cubes into a dish and cover with brandy
Set aside to let the cheese soften
Whisk the Gorgonzola mixture with mascarpone cheese
Add whipping cream and whip until creamy and well combined
Pour the mixture into the prepared loaf pan using a runner scraper to level the top
Refrigerate torta for at least 1 hour, or overnight
Use the plastic wrap to remove the torta from the loaf pan
Carefully flip it onto a rectangular serving plate
